question: Find all products in the Sports category
hint:
SELECT name, price, stock_quantity 
FROM products 
WHERE category = 'Sport'

question: Find all products with a price less than $50
hint: SELECT name, price FROM products WHERE price <= 50;

question: Show all products with a price less than $50
hint: SELECT name, price FROM products WHERE price <= 50;

question: Find all products in the Electronics category
hint:
SELECT id, name, category, price 
FROM products 
WHERE category = 'Electronic'

SELECT id, name, price

question: Find the average order value for each customer region
hint:
SELECT c.region, AVG(o.total_amount) AS avg_order_value
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
WHERE o.status = 'completed'
GROUP BY c.region

question: Find all customers who have placed more than 2 orders
hint:
SELECT c.name, COUNT(o.id) as order_count
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
WHERE COUNT(o.id) > 2
GROUP BY c.name

question: Find all customers who have placed orders with a total amount greater than $500
hint:
SELECT c.name, c.email
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
WHERE o.total_amount > 500
GROUP BY c.name, c.email

question: Show the total quantity sold for each product category
hint:
SELECT p.category, SUM(oi.quantity) as total_quantity
FROM products p, order_items oi
WHERE p.id = oi.product_id
GROUP BY p.category

question: Find the total quantity sold for each product category
hint:
SELECT p.category, SUM(oi.quantity) as total_quantity
FROM products p
JOIN order_items oi ON p.id = oi.product_id
WHERE p.category IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY p.category

question: Find customers who have placed orders in both January and February 2024
hint:
SELECT DISTINCT c.id, c.name
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
WHERE o.order_date >= '2024-01-01' 
  AND o.order_date < '2024-03-01'
GROUP BY c.id, c.name
HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2

question: Find the total revenue generated by each product category
hint:
SELECT 
  p.category,
  SUM(oi.quantity * oi.unit_price) AS total_revenue
FROM products p
JOIN order_items oi ON p.id = oi.product_id
WHERE o.status = 'completed'
GROUP BY p.category
ORDER BY total_revenue DESC

question: Find the total quantity sold for each product category
hint:
SELECT p.category, SUM(oi.quantity) as total_quantity
FROM products p, order_items oi
WHERE p.id = oi.product_id
GROUP BY p.category

question: Find all customers who have placed orders in both January and February 2024
hint:
SELECT DISTINCT c.name, c.email
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
WHERE (o.order_date >= '2024-01-01' AND o.order_date < '2024-02-01')
   OR (o.order_date >= '2024-02-01' AND o.order_date < '2024-03-01')

question: Find the total quantity of each product sold across all orders
hint:
SELECT p.name, SUM(oi.quantity) as total_sold
FROM products p
JOIN order_items oi ON p.id = oi.product_id
WHERE p.stock_quantity > 0
GROUP BY p.name

question: Find customers who have spent more on Electronics products than on all other categories combined
hint:
WITH customer_spending AS (
  SELECT 
    c.id,
    c.name,
    p.category,
    SUM(oi.quantity * oi.unit_price) as category_spending
  FROM customers c
  JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
  JOIN order_items oi ON o.id = oi.order_id
  JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.id
  WHERE o.status = 'completed'
  GROUP BY c.id, c.name, p.category
),
spending_comparison AS (
  SELECT 
    id,
    name,
    SUM(CASE WHEN category = 'Electronics' THEN category_spending ELSE 0 END) as electronics_spending,
    SUM(CASE WHEN category != 'Electronics' THEN category_spending ELSE 0 END) as other_spending
  FROM customer_spending
  GROUP BY id, name
)
SELECT id, name, electronics_spending, other_spending
FROM spending_comparison
WHERE electronics_spending > other_spending
AND electronics_spending > 0;

question: Find products that have been purchased by customers from all three regions
hint:
SELECT p.id, p.name
FROM products p
JOIN order_items oi ON p.id = oi.product_id
JOIN orders o ON oi.order_id = o.id
JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.id
WHERE c.region IN ('West', 'East', 'Central')
GROUP BY p.id, p.name
HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT c.region) = 3;

question: Find products that have been ordered by customers from all three regions
hint:
SELECT p.id, p.name
FROM products p
JOIN order_items oi ON p.id = oi.product_id
JOIN orders o ON oi.order_id = o.id
JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.id
WHERE c.region IN ('West', 'East', 'Central')
GROUP BY p.id, p.name
HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT c.region) >= 3

question: Find customers who have ordered products from at least 3 different categories
hint:
WITH customer_categories AS (
    SELECT 
        c.id,
        c.name,
        p.category
    FROM customers c
    JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
    JOIN order_items oi ON o.id = oi.order_id
    JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.id
    WHERE o.status = 'completed'
    GROUP BY c.id, c.name, p.category
),
category_counts AS (
    SELECT 
        id,
        name,
        COUNT(category) as category_count
    FROM customer_categories
    GROUP BY id, name
)
SELECT id, name
FROM category_counts
WHERE category_count >= 3;

question: Find customers who have placed orders in every month that any customer has placed an order
hint:
WITH monthly_orders AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT 
        strftime('%Y-%m', order_date) as order_month,
        customer_id
    FROM orders
),
all_months AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT strftime('%Y-%m', order_date) as order_month
    FROM orders
),
customer_month_counts AS (
    SELECT 
        customer_id,
        COUNT(DISTINCT order_month) as months_with_orders
    FROM monthly_orders
    GROUP BY customer_id
),
total_months AS (
    SELECT COUNT(*) as total_month_count
    FROM all_months
)
SELECT 
    c.id,
    c.name
FROM customers c
JOIN customer_month_counts cmc ON c.id = cmc.customer_id
WHERE cmc.months_with_orders = (SELECT total_month_count FROM total_months)

question: Find customers who have ordered from all product categories available in the store
hint:
SELECT c.name, c.email
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
JOIN order_items oi ON o.id = oi.order_id
JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.id
WHERE c.id IN (
    SELECT customer_id
    FROM orders o2
    JOIN order_items oi2 ON o2.id = oi2.order_id
    JOIN products p2 ON oi2.product_id = p2.id
    GROUP BY customer_id
    HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT p2.category) = (
        SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT category) FROM products
    )
)
GROUP BY c.id, c.name, c.email;

question: Find customers who have ordered products from at least 3 different categories
hint:
SELECT c.id, c.name
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
JOIN order_items oi ON o.id = oi.order_id
JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.id
GROUP BY c.id, c.name
HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT p.category) >= 3

question: Find customers who have ordered products from at least three different categories
hint:
SELECT c.id, c.name
FROM customers c
JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
JOIN order_items oi ON o.id = oi.order_id
JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.id
GROUP BY c.id, c.name
HAVING COUNT(p.category) >= 3

question: Find customers who have ordered products from at least 3 different categories
hint:
SELECT c.id, c.name
